channel.title: Make Your Windows Password more Secure
channel.description:
THIS IS FOR WINDOWS XP AND WINDOWS SERVE 2003
1. Click Start, click Run, type regedit, and then click OK. 2. Locate and then click the following key in the registry: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\Lsa 3. On the Edit menu, point to New, and then click DWORD Value. 4. Type NoLMHash, and then press ENTER. 5. On the Edit menu, click Modify. 6. Type 1, and then click OK. 7. Restart your computer, and then change your password.

item.title: Make Your Windows Password more Secure
item.dc:creator: @afi afi
item.description:
@afi wrote:

lets just say if someone broke inside your house and wanna to get inside your system they need the passwords so they bootup knoppix std cd, then the take windows/system32/config/sam file write it to a cd go home and crack it with sam inside or a program along that line, they can't get an lmhash and it would take forever to crack the nthash because the hashes are changed everytime you change your password

Read full topic

item.title: Make Your Windows Password more Secure
item.dc:creator: @afi afi
item.description:
@afi wrote:

THIS IS FOR WINDOWS XP AND WINDOWS SERVE 2003

  1. Click Start, click Run, type regedit, and then click OK.
  2. Locate and then click the following key in the registry:
    HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\Lsa
  3. On the Edit menu, point to New, and then click DWORD Value.
  4. Type NoLMHash, and then press ENTER.
  5. On the Edit menu, click Modify.
  6. Type 1, and then click OK.
  7. Restart your computer, and then change your password.

Read full topic
